description: Rangers came from two goals down to snatch a point in a 2-2 draw at home to Hearts.
title: Rangers come from behind to rescue draw v Hearts
title_page: Rangers come from behind to rescue draw v Hearts - BBC Sport
maintext:
Rangers came from two goals down to snatch a point in a 2-2 draw at home to Hearts.
The visitors got off to a fast start at Broadwood and Bayley Hutchison fired them in front after just six minutes.
She scored a second in the first half to give Eva Olid's side a two goal cushion at the break.
Second half substitute Laura Berry changed the game for Rangers and pulled one back with a spectacular strike with 25 minutes to play.
The striker set up Rio Hardy for the equaliser on the 82nd minute to secure a draw for the hosts.
The result leaves Hearts six points behind Rangers while results elsewhere means Jo Potter's side are two behind Glasgow City and Hibs at the top.
